en: All of the dogs were alive.
Spanish is her mother tongue.

en: I completely forgot.

I will be right back!
I'll be back in a minute.
It looks like it's going to clear up soon.

You'd better leave at once.
I'll be there right away.
Here I come.
I'll be there soon.

I'll come right away.

Please come right away.

The skiing season has passed.
I'd like to try skydiving.

en: Would you like soup or salad as a side dish?

Wearing a suit, he stood out.
He stood out because he was wearing a suit.
zh: 他很显眼，因为他穿着西装。

en: I think that my suitcase was stolen.

en: Susie's mother is a very beautiful woman.

Susan is two years older than I am.
Susan is older than me by 2 years.
Sweden has its own language.
It's been a long time.
Speaking of Switzerland, have you ever been there in winter?

en: Who'll take over Cynthia's job when she retires?
zh: 辛西娅退休后，谁来接替她的工作？

en: In Singapore, one way to punish criminals is to whip them.
zh: 在新加坡，惩罚罪犯的一种方式是鞭刑。

en: Jill and John will get married next month.
zh: 吉尔和约翰下个月要结婚了。

en: John is a member of the swimming club.
zh: 约翰是游泳俱乐部的成员。

en: John is in the swimming club.
John ran to the station to catch the last train.
zh: 约翰跑到车站去赶最后一班火车。

en: John ran to the station in order to catch the last train.
zh: 约翰跑到车站为了赶最后一班火车。

en: John tends to get angry when he doesn't get his own way.
zh: 约翰如果不能随心所欲，就容易生气。

en: Jon made his company succeed.
zh: 乔恩使他的公司获得了成功。

en: John writes to his parents once a month.
zh: 约翰每月给他的父母写一次信。

en: John is more clever than Bill.
John is more intelligent than Bill.
John will probably pass the examination.
zh: 约翰很可能会通过考试。

en: John likes the nurse.
John isn't the kind of man who would betray you.
zh: 约翰不是那种会背叛你的人。

en: John was a lazy person until he met you.
zh: 在遇到你之前，约翰是个懒惰的人。

en: John's two years older than me.
John is two years older than me.
John is two years older than I am.
John is older than Robert.
John's mother looks very young, so she is often mistaken for his older sister.
zh: 约翰的母亲看起来很年轻，所以她经常被误认为是他的姐姐。

en: John and I took turns driving.
John and Mary had different opinions about that important matter.
zh: 约翰和玛丽对那个重要问题有不同的看法。

en: John and Beth are the same age.
I'd like to talk to John.
Mr. Johnson's room was a large room.
zh: 约翰逊先生的房间是一个大房间。

en: Mr. Johnson's room was a large one.
zh: 约翰逊先生的房间很大。

en: Is Mr. Johnson in?
John's older than I thought.
zh: 约翰比我想象的要年长。

en: I hope that John comes.
I hope that John will come.
It was last week that John bought a second-hand car.
zh: 约翰是上周买了一辆二手车。

en: I heard John speak to Mr. Brown.
zh: 我听到约翰和布朗先生说话。

en: If John had come, I wouldn't have had to.
zh: 如果约翰来了，我就不必来了。

en: If John had come, I wouldn't have had to come.
zh: 如果约翰来了，我就不必来了。

en: The shopping center is one mile ahead.
zh: 购物中心就在前方一英里处。

en: Mr. Jones is tasting the soup his wife made.
zh: 琼斯先生正在品尝他妻子做的汤。

en: A farewell party was held for Mr. Jones.
zh: 为琼斯先生举行了欢送会。

en: A goodbye party was held for Mr. Jones.

en: Is Mr. Jones in the office?
Mr. Jones had Mary go to the dentist.
zh: 琼斯先生让玛丽去看牙医。

en: Mr. Jones made Mary go to the dentist.
zh: 琼斯先生让玛丽去看牙医。

en: Mr. Jones hasn't been here as far as I know.
zh: 据我所知，琼斯先生还没来过这里。

en: A Mr. Jones has come to see you.
zh: 一位名叫琼斯先生的人来找你。

en: A person named Jones has come to see you.
zh: 一位名叫琼斯的人来找你。

en: Joe is madly in love with that girl.
zh: 乔疯狂地爱上了那个女孩。

en: It was Mr. White that gave Joe this ticket.
zh: 是怀特先生给了乔这张票。

en: Short skirts have already gone out of fashion.
Short skirts are already out of fashion.
Mr. Jordan is the chairman.
Mr. Jordan is the chairperson.
Every time Uncle George visited our house, he always brought us a gift.
zh: 每次乔治叔叔来我们家，他总是给我们带礼物。

en: George Bush is the forty-first president of the United States of America.
zh: 乔治·布什是美利坚合众国第四十一任总统。

en: George is five years older than I am.
George is five years older than me.
George is captain of our team.
Without knowing anything, George began to climb the stairs.
zh: 在什么都不知道的情况下，乔治开始爬楼梯。

en: George seems to be a good boy.
zh: 乔治看起来是个好孩子。

en: George weighs as least 70 kilograms.
It's certain that George will come.
George will come for sure.
I don't know if George is coming or not.
zh: 我不知道乔治会不会来。

en: I don't know whether George will come or not.
zh: 我不知道乔治会不会来。

en: I'm not sure if George will like this idea.
zh: 我不确定乔治是否会喜欢这个主意。

en: George, I have something to tell you. You have a mother, don't you?
zh: 乔治，我有件事要告诉你。 你有妈妈，对吧？

en: Mr. Joel is now on duty.
zh: 乔尔先生现在正在值班。

en: When I learned that Julie was coming for a visit tomorrow, I was so surprised I almost fainted.
zh: 当我得知朱莉明天要来拜访时，我太惊讶了，差点晕倒。

en: Julia felt like crying after she heard that news.
zh: 朱莉听到这个消息后，很想哭。

en: Is Mr. Schmidt at home now?
zh: 施密特先生现在在家吗？

en: Judy is a very clever student.
zh: 朱迪是个非常聪明的学生。

en: Can I speak with Judy?
Judy looked at me.
Please give me a dozen cream puffs.
Champagne, please.
Water is not coming out of the shower.
I'm going to take a shower.
I'm going to have a shower.
The shower is broken.
The shower doesn't work.
There's no doubt that Sharon is capable.
zh: 毫无疑问，莎伦是有能力的。

en: Then I'll come again later.
I'm sorry to have bothered you.
I'm sorry that I bothered you.
Even though Jack was tired, he was looking well.
zh: 即使杰克很累，他看起来气色很好。

en: Jack was tired, but he looked well.
zh: 杰克很累，但他看起来气色很好。

en: As soon as Jack saw her, he burst out crying.
zh: 杰克一见到她，就 burst out crying。

en: Jack is a lot wiser than anybody else.

en: Jessie is smarter than anyone else.
Jack didn't make any mistakes on the math test.
zh: 杰克在数学考试中没有犯任何错误。

en: Jack has no goals for his life.
zh: 杰克对生活没有任何目标。

en: Jack has no goals in life.

en: Jack is three years older than me.
Jack is three years older than I am.
We lost sight of Jack in the crowd.
zh: 我们在人群中失去了杰克的踪影。

en: Jack was born on August the tenth.
When Mary entered the room, Jack suddenly stopped talking.
zh: 当玛丽走进房间时，杰克突然停止了说话。

en: Jack suddenly stopped talking when Mary entered the room.
zh: 当玛丽走进房间时，杰克突然停止了说话。

en: Jack and I agreed to take turns working at the office on Saturdays.
zh: 杰克和我同意轮流在周六在办公室工作。

en: Jazz isn't my speciality.
It seems like Jakob is in love.
Have you dug up potatoes?
I'll boil the potatoes for you.
When was the potato introduced in Japan?

en: Please peel the potatoes.
OK, I'll order it.
How old is she?
Goodbye, I'll see you at the time we agreed on.
zh: 再见，我们到约定的时间见。

en: Goodbye. I'll see you at the time we agreed on.
zh: 再见，我们到约定的时间见。

en: Would you like me to see you home?
Well, at least let me set up the table.
zh: 好吧，至少让我来摆桌子。

en: Well, at least let me set the table.
zh: 好吧，至少让我来摆桌子。

en: At least let me help set the table.
Cold, damp days are bad for your health.
zh: 寒冷潮湿的天气对你的健康不利。

en: Everyone but Jim came.
With the exception of Jim, everybody came.
Jim isn't a lawyer, but a doctor.
zh: 吉姆不是律师，而是医生。

en: Jim's not a lawyer. He's a doctor.
zh: 吉姆不是律师。他是医生。

en: Jim entered the room quietly so he wouldn't wake the baby.
zh: 吉姆悄悄地走进房间，以免吵醒婴儿。

en: As soon as Jim got home, he crawled into bed.
zh: 吉姆一到家就爬上床睡觉了。

en: Jimmy often stays up all night.
Jimmy, it's bedtime.
Jimmy, it's time for you to go to bed.
Would you please stay here for a while?
zh: 请你在这里待一会儿好吗？

en: I've got a ton of homework.
I heard that you became the manager of the Sydney branch.
zh: 我听说你成了悉尼分公司的经理。

en: But why?
I can't, however, agree with your opinion.
zh: 然而，我不能同意你的意见。

en: But he slept like a baby.
zh: 但他睡得像个婴儿一样。

en: Except that the one who sent me to baptize with water told me...
zh: 只是那位差我用水施洗的告诉我...

en: Jeff searched for three months before he found a job.
zh: 杰夫找了三个月才找到工作。

en: Jeff wore the tie Kim had given him for a birthday present.
zh: 杰夫戴着金送给他的生日礼物领带。

en: Jeff wore the tie that Kim had given him for a birthday present.
zh: 杰夫戴着金送给他的生日礼物领带。

en: The jet plane took off in an instant.
Jane was angry.
Jane goes to bed early and gets up early.
Jane is doing her homework.
Jane has been acting in movies since she was eleven.
zh: 简从十一岁起就开始演电影。

en: Jane objected to our decision.
Jane opposed our decision.
Jane understands how you think.
Jane is not as tall as Mary.
Jane had a very boring weekend.
zh: 简度过了一个非常无聊的周末。

en: Jane is not such a bad person.
Jane became taller than her mother.
Jane always pretended that she was very rich.
zh: 简总是假装自己很有钱。

en: Jane always behaved like she was very rich.
zh: 简总是表现得好像她很有钱。

en: Jane had no idea when she should go or where she should go.
zh: 简不知道她应该什么时候去，或者应该去哪里。

en: It took a week for Jane to get over her cold.
zh: 简花了一个星期才从感冒中恢复过来。

en: We're sold out of jeans.
Please go to San Francisco.
This pigeon flew from San Francisco to New York.
zh: 这只鸽子从旧金山飞到纽约。

en: In the morning, Sandra eats a slice of bread and drinks a cup of coffee.
zh: 早上，桑德拉吃一片面包，喝一杯咖啡。

en: Sandra offered me her seat in the train.
zh: 在火车上，桑德拉把她的座位让给了我。

en: The monkey fell from the tree.
Sally was absent from school for two weeks, so she has to work hard to catch up with her class.
zh: 莎莉缺课两周，所以她必须努力学习才能赶上她的班级。

en: Sally is two years senior to Ken.
Sally is two years older than Ken.
Would you like a little more salad?
Don't leave without saying goodbye.
Sam was able to enter the school's basketball team.
zh: 萨姆成功进入了学校的篮球队。

en: Sam managed to get on the school basketball team.
zh: 萨姆设法进入了学校篮球队。

en: Tom, don't die.
"Now," said Mr. Wood.
Well, which way do you want to take your first lesson?
zh: 好吧，你想以哪种方式开始你的第一课？

en: I'll begin doing the job right away.
zh: 我马上开始做这项工作。

en: Do your homework now.
Do your homework right away.
Football is the most popular sport in Brazil.
zh: 足球是巴西最受欢迎的运动。

en: Soccer is the most popular sport in Brazil.
zh: 足球是巴西最受欢迎的运动。

en: It must've been a shock to you.
zh: 这对你来说一定是个打击。

en: The die is cast.
Let the game begin.
Let's begin.
Let's start!
So now it's my turn.
Now it's my turn.
Let's go, Ken.
You must examine that issue.
zh: 你必须调查一下那个问题。

en: Bustle up, you boys!
Hasten, my lads!
Come on, guys, let's hurry.
Come on, the bus is here.
Do come in.
Let's get started.
Well, let's get going!
Well, let's go.
It's now your turn.
Now it's your turn.
Now, it's your turn.
Hurry up! We'll be late.
Come with us.
Which of your parents do you think you look like?
zh: 你觉得你长得像你父母中的哪一个？

en: As you can see, I'm still alive, and that's the main thing. My father, too, says that's what's most important.
zh: 如你所见，我还活着，这才是最重要的。我父亲也说这是最重要的。

en: Please call me if you want me.
zh: 如果你需要我，请给我打电话。

en: Your friendship means a lot to me.
zh: 你的友谊对我意义重大。

en: I am sorry that I have not written to you for such a long time.
zh: 很抱歉这么久没给你写信了。

en: We'd appreciate a reply.
zh: 如果您能回复，我们将不胜感激。

en: I would appreciate a reply.
zh: 如果您能回复，我将不胜感激。

en: I'd be delighted if you'd come with me.
zh: 如果你能和我一起来，我会很高兴的。

en: I'd appreciate it if you'd come with me.
zh: 如果你能和我一起来，我会很感激的。

en: Do come if you can.
Have you decided what you want to order?
zh: 你决定好要点什么了吗？

en: Please let me know when you are ready to order.
zh: 您准备好点餐的时候请告诉我。

en: I will follow your advice.
I can't thank you enough for all your kindness.
zh: 我对你的好意感激不尽。

en: You are kind to help me.
What is your address?
Is your husband at home?
I'm sorry, but we cannot meet your requirements.
zh: 很抱歉，我们无法满足您的要求。

en: Give my regards to your family.
zh: 请代我向你的家人问好。

en: We're looking for somebody who can use a computer.
zh: 我们在找一个会用电脑的人。

en: The computer is to her left.
The computer is often compared to the human brain.
Computers are very useful.
I'd like to drive across the USA in a convertible.
zh: 我想开着敞篷车横穿美国。

en: It isn't safe for a girl to go out by herself so late at night.
zh: 这么晚了，女孩子一个人出门不安全。

en: It's not safe for a girl to go out by herself this late at night.
zh: 这么晚了，女孩子一个人出门不安全。

en: I never dreamt of there being such a quiet place.
zh: 我从没想过会有这么安静的地方。

en: I didn't think that it would turn out like this.
zh: 我没想到事情会变成这样。

en: I think it's strange that no one is on the street this time of the day.
zh: 我觉得很奇怪，一天中的这个时候街上竟然没有人。

en: I find it odd that there isn't anyone on the street at this hour.
zh: 我觉得很奇怪，这个时间街上竟然没有人。

en: I've never been this happy before.
zh: 我从来没有这么高兴过。

en: Have you ever heard of a custom as strange as this?
zh: 你有没有听说过这么奇怪的风俗？

en: This is the way they capture elephants alive.
zh: 他们就是这样活捉大象的。

en: I never expected such a nice hotel in a place like this.
zh: 我从没想过在这种地方会有这么好的酒店。

en: I never expected to find such a nice hotel in a place like this.
zh: 我从没想过在这种地方能找到这么好的酒店。

en: I've never seen such a beautiful sunset.
zh: 我从没见过这么美的日落。

en: I've never seen such a wonderful sunset.
zh: 我从没见过这么棒的日落。

en: Have you ever seen such a nice film?
zh: 你看过这么好的电影吗？

en: Have you ever seen a film this good?
zh: 你看过这么棒的电影吗？

en: Have you seen such a wonderful movie before?
zh: 你以前看过这么精彩的电影吗？

en: Thank you very much for sending me such a nice present.
zh: 非常感谢你送我这么好的礼物。

en: The concert was short. However, it was very good.
zh: 音乐会很短，但是非常好。

en: I had to leave the theater in the middle of the concert.
zh: 我不得不中途离开剧院。

en: Talking during a concert is rude.
zh: 在音乐会上说话是不礼貌的。

en: It's rude to talk during a concert.
zh: 在音乐会上说话是不礼貌的。

en: It's bad manners to talk during a concert.
zh: 在音乐会上说话是很没礼貌的。

en: Can I buy a ticket for the concert here?
zh: 我可以在这里买音乐会的票吗？

en: Columbus proved that the world isn't flat.
zh: 哥伦布证明了地球不是平的。

en: This is an immutable truth.
zh: 这是一个颠扑不破的真理。

en: This is true.
Can't you give me a lower price?
zh: 你不能给我更低的价格吗？

en: I'll buy this.
May I eat this?
Please send this by registered mail.
Please hand this in at the front desk.
Please help me take this down.
Where will it be OK to put this, I am uncertain.
zh: 我不确定放在哪里合适。

en: I'm not sure where I should put this.
zh: 我不确定我应该把这个放在哪里。

en: Do you have one a little bigger than these?
zh: 你们有比这些大一点的吗？

en: These are cakes that she baked herself.
zh: 这些是她自己烤的蛋糕。

en: These are our books.
These are my books and those are his books.
zh: 这些是我的书，那些是他的书。

en: These are my sister's magazines.
Are these your things?
These green leaves will turn red in the fall.
zh: 这些绿叶在秋天会变红。

en: We can't see the view because of these trees.
zh: 因为这些树，我们看不到风景。

en: All these books are mine.
These books can be borrowed from the library for one week.
zh: 这些书可以从图书馆借阅一周。

en: It's dangerous to mix these substances.
These clothes are dirty and need to be washed.
These boxes are made out of plastic.
These birds migrate to North Africa in the winter.
zh: 这些鸟冬天会迁徙到北非。

en: Choose one from among these products.
zh: 从这些产品中选择一个。

en: I'd like you to look over these documents.
zh: 我想让你看看这些文件。

en: Will you remind me to mail these letters?
zh: 你能提醒我寄这些信吗？

en: These facts will show that his story is true.
zh: 这些事实将表明他的故事是真的。

en: Take away these dishes, please.
These words aren't used in spoken language.
zh: 这些词语不在口语中使用。

en: Remember these rules.
All of these meetings are in English.
zh: 所有这些会议都是用英语进行的。

en: These flowers bloom in the spring.
Whose pens are these?
These dresses are too large.
This data isn't accurate at all.
This cake is delicious.
This cake is good.
These oranges have rotted.
Will there ever be something better than this?
zh: 会有比这更好的东西吗？

en: Could you please show me a camera that's cheaper than this one?

en: Please be careful that you don't break this vase.
zh: 请小心，不要打破这个花瓶。

en: It might have been Miss Satoh who sent these flowers.
zh: 可能就是佐藤小姐送的这些花。

en: These flowers can be seen around Hokkaido.
zh: 在北海道各地都能看到这些花。

en: These flowers are beautiful, aren't they?
These flowers aren't only beautiful, but they smell nice.
zh: 这些花不仅漂亮，而且闻起来也很香。

en: These flowers have a unique smell.
zh: 这些花有一种独特的气味。

en: What's this flower called?
This song makes me think of when I was young.
zh: 这首歌让我想起了我年轻的时候。

en: Whenever I hear that song, I think of my younger days.
zh: 每当我听到那首歌，我就会想起我的年轻时代。

en: This fruit smells nasty.
This fruit has an unpleasant smell.
zh: 这水果有一种令人不愉快的气味。

en: I don't like the way this fruit smells.
zh: 我不喜欢这水果的味道。

en: This house isn't for sale.
This house is too small to live in.
zh: 这房子太小，不适合居住。

en: This house isn't very large.
This house will rent easily.
It'll be easy to find a renter for this house.

en: It'll be easy to find someone to rent this house.

en: The owner of this house is Mr. Yamada.

en: Nobody lives in this house.

en: Delivery isn't included in the price.
This music was composed by Bach.
zh: 这首音乐是巴赫作曲的。

en: This film is based on a novel.

en: This movie is worth watching.
This movie is indeed a timeless masterpiece.

en: I found this movie very interesting.
zh: 我觉得这部电影很有趣。

en: I don't think that this movie is interesting.
zh: 我不觉得这部电影有趣。

en: What would it take to have this chair repaired?
zh: 修理这把椅子需要多少钱？

en: About how much would it cost to have this chair repaired?

This chair needs to be repaired.

en: This shirt needs to be washed.

en: The curry rice at this restaurant is delicious.

en: This apple is sour.

zh: 这种错误很容易被忽略。

en: This milk will keep for two days.

en: Can I borrow this pen?
This bed is too hard to sleep on.

en: There's a little whiskey in this bottle.

en: This banana went bad.
What's in this bag?
You're going in the wrong direction.

en: I think I'll buy this tie.

en: This necktie is hard to tie.

en: There's a mailbox somewhere along this street.

en: The paint on the door isn't dry yet.

en: This computer is better than that one.

en: This cork won't come out.
Don't tell anyone this.

en: Her reputation was hurt a lot by this.

en: This coffee is too hot for me to drink.

en: There are forty students in our class.
How many boys are in this class?
These mushrooms aren't edible.
This mushroom isn't good to eat.

zh: 我觉得修理这个相机要花你一万日元以上。

en: Will you show me how to use this camera?

en: This camera is not loaded with film.

Give me all the money.
Please give me this money.

en: May I eat this cake?
May I eat this orange?

en: We don't have snow here.

zh: 你知道这附近有什么好吃的餐厅吗？

en: I lost my key somewhere around here.
Many things happen between the cup and the lip.
There's no problem with working hard, but it's also very important to know what you're working for.
zh: 努力工作没有问题，但知道为什么而工作也很重要。

en: This is the person I talked about the other day.
zh: 这就是我前几天说的那个人。

en: This is the person I spoke about the other day.
zh: 这就是我前几天说的那个人。

en: Are you new here?
Get over here.

en: This is your key.
You put in too much pepper.
zh: 你放了太多的胡椒粉了。

en: Recently, the increasing diversity of computer use has extended far beyond the realms of the office.
zh: 最近，电脑用途越来越多样化，已经远远超出了办公室的范围。

en: Jane has been quiet and grouchy for the past few days.
zh: 简过去几天一直很安静，而且脾气暴躁。

en: Jane has been quiet and grumpy for the past few days.
zh: 简过去几天一直很安静，而且脾气暴躁。

en: Jane has been quiet and moody for the past few days.
zh: 简过去几天一直很安静，而且情绪低落。

en: Her health has been declining these past few months.
zh: 她这几个月来健康状况一直在下降。

en: Open your heart.
Don't forget to take your umbrella when you leave here.
zh: 离开这里的时候别忘了带伞。

en: Don't come here.
This is a restricted area.
Is this a duty-free shop?
This is the house where she used to live.
Here's where they usually have dinner.
zh: 这是他们通常吃晚饭的地方。

en: It's a no parking area here.
This is the park where we said our last goodbye.
zh: 这是我们最后道别的公园。

en: This is where I was born and raised.
zh: 这是我出生和长大的地方。

en: Here is the hospital where I was born.
This place isn't convenient for public transportation.
zh: 这个地方公共交通不方便。

en: Smoking is prohibited.
Smoking isn't permitted here.
I've been here many times.
I've been here a number of times.
It's very cold here.
It's warm here all year round.
The majority of students here are diligent.
zh: 这里的大部分学生都很勤奋。

en: Most of the students here are diligent.
zh: 这里的大部分学生都很勤奋。

en: How many times an hour do the buses here leave?

en: About how many times an hour do these buses leave?

en: There's a book here.
There are books here.
Can I park my car here?
You can't park your car here.
Your dog is here.
Here's your dog.
There is one book here.
There are at least 500 students here.
zh: 这里至少有五百名学生。

en: My album is here.
Here's my album.
Please sign here.
The people who were here have all gone.
zh: 曾经在这里的人都走了。

en: All the people who were here have left.
zh: 所有在这里的人都离开了。

en: Would you please write your name here?

en: It's been ten years since I came to live here.
zh: 我来这里住已经十年了。

en: Please study here.
A lot of soldiers died here.
zh: 很多士兵在这里牺牲了。

en: I eat here.
I'll eat here.
I'll eat it here.
Can I take a picture here?
May I take pictures here?
I get off here.
I never expected to see you here.
zh: 我真没想到会在这里见到你。

en: What is going on here?
What do you think happened here?
zh: 你觉得这里发生了什么？

en: We can't play baseball here.
zh: 我们不能在这里打棒球。

en: You can't swim here.
You aren't supposed to swim here.
That isn't how we do things here.
zh: 我们这里不是这样做的。

en: That's not how we do things here.
zh: 我们这里不是这么做的。

en: We could live in peace here.
zh: 我们可以在这里和平共处。

en: Would you mind if I smoked here?
zh: 我在这里抽烟你介意吗？

en: I didn't think I'd meet you here.
zh: 没想到会在这里遇见你。

en: I'm happy to see you here.
It's just between you and me, but Kazuo's wife is pregnant.
zh: 就你知我知，和夫的妻子怀孕了。

en: This is the room he rushed into.
zh: 这就是他冲进去的房间。

en: It hurts here.
Mt. Fuji can be seen from here.
zh: 从这里可以看到富士山。

en: How long does it take to walk to your house from here?
zh: 从这里走到你家要多久？

en: How long does it take to get from here to your house on foot?
zh: 从这里步行到你家要多久？

en: It's a fifteen minute walk from here to the campus.
zh: 从这里走到校园要十五分钟。

en: It takes fifteen minutes to walk from here to the campus.
zh: 从这里走到校园要花十五分钟。

en: How long does it take to get from here to the station?
How far is it from here to that station?

en: Is this where your mother works?
zh: 这是你妈妈工作的地方吗？

en: Is this the place where your mother works?
zh: 这是你妈妈工作的地方吗？

en: During the past 2 or 3 years, many Japanese have been killed or injured in traffic accidents while traveling overseas.
zh: 在过去的两三年里，许多日本人在海外旅行时死于或伤于交通事故。

en: Do you drink coffee?
A cup of coffee, please.
One cup of coffee, please.
I'll make some coffee.
I've brought a cup of coffee.

Coffee, please.

I prefer coffee.

There are many kinds of coffee.
There are various kinds of coffee.
I put some milk in my coffee.

en: He put milk in his coffee.
Please give me some coffee.
Please give me a coffee.

There's not enough coffee.
I want to drink a coffee.

I would like to have a cup of coffee.
Put your coat on.
Take your coat off.
You should wear a coat.
Please take off your coat.
Put the coat on the hanger.
This kind of book is of no use to us.
He isn't the only one with this opinion.
zh: 有这种看法的人不只他一个。

en: This type of person isn't interesting.
This type of person is boring.
See that this never happens again.
zh: 确保这种事再也不要发生了。

en: Let's decide by coin toss.
What is Ken doing now?
Ken couldn't remember his name.
Ken couldn't remember that guy's name.
zh: 健不记得那个人的名字了。

en: Ken couldn't recall that man's name.
zh: 健不记得那个人的名字了。

en: Ken asked about his father's condition.
Ken has to run fast.
Ken needs to run fast.
Ken seems to be a friendly person.
zh: 健看起来是个友善的人。

en: Ken appears to be a friendly person.
zh: 健看起来是个友善的人。

en: Among the three of them, Ken runs the fastest.
zh: 他们三个人当中，健跑得最快。

en: Ken visited his teacher yesterday.
zh: 健昨天拜访了他的老师。

en: Ken ran up the hill.
Ken ran up the slope.
Ken didn't have the nerve to try it again.
Ken didn't have the courage to try it again.
Ken isn't brave enough to try again.
zh: 健不够勇敢，不敢再试一次。

en: Ken gave up.
Ken shared the room with his older brother.
zh: 健和他哥哥合住一个房间。

en: Ken decided to go abroad.
No matter what I tried, Ken wouldn't do what I told him to do.
zh: 无论我怎么尝试，健都不肯按照我说的做。

en: No matter what I did, Ken wouldn't listen to me.
zh: 无论我做什么，健都不听我的。

en: Ken's team is likely to win.
Should I call Ken back?
Who is taller, Ken or Taro?
Kent is a born leader.
Tom and Mary went out of their way to come to the station to see me off.
zh: 汤姆和玛丽特意赶到车站为我送行。

en: The desk Ken uses is old.
The desk that Ken uses is old.
zh: 肯用的那张桌子很旧了。

en: It's strange that Ken doesn't agree with us.
zh: 肯竟然不同意我们的意见，真奇怪。

en: Ken lit the candles.
Nobody believed Kevin because he always makes up stories.
zh: 没有人相信凯文，因为他总是编故事。

en: Mr. Kennedy pointed out our mistakes.
zh: 肯尼迪先生指出了我们的错误。

en: My grandmother mailed the letter this morning.
zh: 我奶奶今天早上寄出了信。

en: I was able to solve that problem this morning.
zh: 今天早上我能够解决那个问题。

en: None of the games were exciting.
zh: 没有一个游戏是令人兴奋的。

en: The games were all boring.
Don't eat too much cake.
When making a cake, you must use eggs, butter and sugar.
zh: 做蛋糕时，你必须使用鸡蛋、黄油和糖。

en: Won't you have another piece of cake?
Can I offer you another piece of cake?
zh: 要不要我再给你一块蛋糕？

en: Please have some cake.
Please eat some cake.
The cake was crawling with ants.
There were two cakes.
I saw Bob and Mary while I was waiting for Kate.
zh: 我等凯特的时候，看到了鲍勃和玛丽。

en: Kate went to the party to see her friends.
zh: 凯特去参加聚会是为了见她的朋友们。

en: I met Bob and Mary while I was waiting for Kate.
zh: 我等凯特的时候，遇到了鲍勃和玛丽。

en: Kate stays in Izu on weekends.
I found out that Kate was wealthy.
Kate was absent from the meeting.
Kate didn't attend the meeting.
Kate is crazy about a new singer who often appears on TV.
zh: 凯特对一个经常在电视上出现的新歌手很着迷。

en: Mary has not arrived yet.
Kate is very energetic.
Kate was forced to read the book.
Kate was surprised when she saw that big dog.
zh: 凯特看到那只大狗时很惊讶。

en: Kate has three times as many records as Jane does.
zh: 凯特的唱片数量是简的三倍。

en: Kate looks amazing.
Kate's father is in the vicinity of the house.

en: Kate's father is near the house.
zh: 凯特的父亲在房子附近。

en: Keisuke is taller than I am.
Keisuke is taller than me.
Grace goes to the telephone upstairs.
zh: 格蕾丝上楼去打电话了。

en: Grace goes upstairs to the extension telephone.
zh: 格蕾丝上楼去分机电话那里了。

en: Do you know whether or not Grace is at home?
Mr. Grey didn't enjoy his work.
zh: 格雷先生不喜欢他的工作。

en: Grace looked angry.
Graham Greene is one of my favorite authors.
zh: 格雷厄姆·格林是我最喜欢的作家之一。

en: Graham Greene is a favorite author of mine.
zh: 格雷厄姆·格林是我最喜欢的作家之一。

en: I need to do some shopping since Christmas is coming soon.
zh: 圣诞节快到了，我需要去购物。

en: How many more days are there until Christmas?
Please wrap it like a Christmas present.
zh: 请把它像圣诞礼物一样包装起来。

en: Christmas is soon, right?
